benchmark_details.name: BLADE (Benchmark suite for LLM-driven Automated Design and Evolution)
benchmark_details.overview: BLADE is a modular and extensible framework specifically designed for benchmarking LLM-driven Automated Algorithm Discovery methods in a continuous black-box optimisation context.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate LLM-driven Automated Algorithm Discovery methods for continuous black-box optimisation.

data.source: Several collections of single-objective continuous optimisation problems with instance generation mechanisms, including MA-BBOB and SBOX-COST.

methodology.calculation: AOCC is calculated based on the average performance of algorithms over multiple runs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AOCC and ELO ratings indicate more effective optimisation algorithms.
methodology.baseline_results: Best-performing algorithms were compared against state-of-the-art human-designed algorithms like CMA-ES.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through use cases demonstrating its application in LLM-driven AAD methods.
